definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: The babysitter will be hired to take care of the baby when the parents go aboard next month.
sentences.chinese: 保母将被雇来照顾小孩，当下个月他的父母出国时。

sentences.english: The babysitter is being hired to take care of the baby now.
sentences.chinese: 这个保母正被雇来照顾小孩子。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, but my babysitter cannot stay after nine.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，我的保母无法待到九点以后。

sentences.english: The handbags were still on the table the next day, when my babysitter Lauren stopped by.
sentences.chinese: 该手袋还放在桌上，第二天，当我的保母劳伦阻挡的。

sentences.english: The baby-sitter tried to ignore the children's shouting.
sentences.chinese: 这个保母试著不去理睬孩子们的喊叫。

sentences.english: Don't let your child try to control your decisions, such as who you've chosen as a baby-sitter.
sentences.chinese: 别让孩子尝试控制你的决定，例如，你选择谁保母。

definition: variant of 保鏢|保镖[bao3 biao1]
variant of 媽咪|妈咪[ma1 mi5]
student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext/also written 借口[jie4 kou3]
